revised_title: Observations of Venus and the Sun's Limb during the 1769 Transit
tldr: In this letter, Mr. Benedict Ferner describes his observations of the 1769 transit of Venus. He discusses the challenges he faced due to atmospheric conditions and the trembling of the Sun's and Venus's limbs. Ferner also provides details about the instruments he used, such as the achromatic telescope of Dollond, and the difference in meridians between Stockholm and Upsal. His observations contribute to the understanding of the transit of Venus and the behavior of the Sun and planets.
